intro: Alphonsea sonlaensis, commonly known as the Son La alphonsea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Vietnam and Cambodia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Alphonsea sonlaensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
